definition: course/direction (a ship or plane is heading in)
towards/to face/to turn towards/direction/to support/to side with/shortly before/formerly/always/all along/(suffix) suitable for .../oriented to ...

sentences.english: In what direction should the pilot head in order to travel due north ?
sentences.chinese: 爲使這架飛機向正北航行，駕駛員應取什麼航向？

sentences.english: Your present course too close to port limit of fairway.
sentences.chinese: 你船現在的航向離航道的右邊界太近。

sentences.english: Your present course too close to starboard limit of fairway.
sentences.chinese: 你船現在的航向離航道的右邊界太近。

sentences.english: And the control panel telling us where we are, where we are heading and what speed we are achieving.
sentences.chinese: 控制儀表會告訴我們筏子的方位，航向和航速。

sentences.english: Check Gyro and Magnetic courses frequently.
sentences.chinese: 經常覈對陀螺羅經和磁羅經航向。

sentences.english: Without ideal as the lighthouse, even the best steersman will get lost.
sentences.chinese: 沒有理想的燈塔，再好的舵手也會迷失航向。
報告航向和飛行高度層。

sentences.english: To boldly go where no man/one has gone before.
sentences.chinese: 勇敢地航向前人所未至的宇宙洪荒。

sentences.english: The boat changed direction and headed west.
sentences.chinese: 那條船改變航向，朝西駛去。

sentences.english: M/V XX. What is your course and speed?
sentences.chinese: 船，你船的航向和航速是多少？

sentences.english: Change radar to true motion course-up.
sentences.chinese: 雷達轉換至真運動航向向上。

sentences.english: For the first time in my life, I was aware that the change of course has begun.
sentences.chinese: 這是第一次，我驚覺到自己生命航向的改變幅度。

sentences.english: Slowly at first but picking up speed, the ships head seaward.
sentences.chinese: 剛開始船速緩慢，接着慢慢加速航向海洋。

sentences.english: Also, for love , missing way should retune as soon as possible.
sentences.chinese: 愛情也是一樣，迷失了方向要及時調整航向。

definition: to diverge (from bearing, flight path etc)/off course/to yaw
to return to the point of departure
on full rudder/turning as sharply as possible
